title-group.article-title: Avant-Garde Re-Enactment: "World Mirror Cinema, Decasia", and "The Heart of the World"

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2009 The University of Texas Press

abstract.p: This essay looks at how a number of avant-garde films that work with cinematic images of the past involve spectators in the imaginative creation of historical worlds. These films are re-enactments, not in the sense of offering re-creations of specific historical events, but in the sense of involving spectators in an experience that offers them a feeling for the past.
